name: Slack Albumlist
description: A Flask webserver for scraping and sharing albums in Slack

APP_SETTINGS.description: Which config class of settings to use (see: config.py).

SECRET_KEY.description: A secret key for verifying magic Flask stuff.

SLACK_TEAM.description: Slack team name identified by the subdomain.

SLACK_API_TOKEN.description: To be able to fully scrape the archives of a given channel, an API token is required but not necessary for the rest of the functionality.

SLACKBOT_TOKEN.description: The fallback for many operations is for Slackbot to notify the team when something happens. This token can be found in the custom Slackbot integration.

BOT_URL_TEMPLATE.description: Standard URL template to post to to notify the team.

DEFAULT_CHANNEL.description: The default channel for the responses to post to.

APP_TOKEN_A.description: The config looks for Slack integration tokens starting wtih APP_TOKEN. These are used to allow access to any of the /slack/[endpoints].

ADMIN_ID_MARYJANE.description: The config looks for Slack user ID's for access against some of the [admin] only slash commands.

LIST_NAME.description: A name given for the team's album list.

SLACK_CLIENT_ID.description: The Slack app's client ID for validating authentication when adding to a Slack team.

SLACK_CLIENT_SECRET.description: The Slack app's client secret for validating authentication when adding to a Slack team.

SLACK_CHANNEL_ID.description: The channel to scrape with the API for new albums when using doing a full scrape.
